data: Order product as per site procedure. Consultation with Hematopathologist is available, contact TM
Informed consent must be present on patient record
Recommended dose 1 unit per 5 kg body weight up to 10 units depending on indication
This dosage should increase fibrinogen by 0.5 to 1 g/L
Urgent, unit, IV, once, Administer each over: 30 -60 minutes, T;N
Urgent, unit, IV, once,  Administer each over: Other specify in comments, 5-30 minutes, T;N

Recommended dose of 3 to 5 mL/kg up to a recommended maximum of:
-15 mL for neonates less than or equal to 5 kg
-30 mL for neonates between 6 to 10 kg
For children greater than 10 kg, follow pediatric dosing of 1 unit per 5 kg body weight

There is considerable variation in the fibrinogen content per unit of cryoprecipitate, therefore for neonates less than or equal to 10 kg, the fibrinogen level should be monitored closely and the dosage titrated to achieve the desired fibrinogen level
Urgent, mL, IV, once, Administer each over: 30-60 minutes, T;N
The dose of Fibrinogen Concentrate to be administered and the frequency of administration are based on the extent of bleeding, laboratory values, and the clinical condition of the individual patient
Determination of the patient’s fibrinogen level is recommended before and during the treatment
For patients with congenital afibrinogenemia and hypofibrinogenemia, the dosage is 70 mg/kg if the patient’s fibrinogen level is unknown
Urgent, g, IV, once, Administser each over: Other specify in comments, 30-60 minutes, T;N
Order Group and Screen if ABO is not already on file, not required for fibrinogen
Conditional Order - Nurse to Place Lab Order - One Time
If/when Cryoprecipitate transfusion completed, then order fibrinogen level to be drawn with next bloodwork
If/when Cryoprecipitate transfusion completed, then order fibrinogen level to be drawn 1 hour post-transfusion
If/when Fibrinogen transfusion completed, then order fibrinogen level to be drawn with next bloodwork
If/when Fibrinogen transfusion completed, then order fibrinogen level to be drawn 1 hour post-transfusion
